back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –X. X is the shelter value of your location.
[cultist]: –2. For each point you fail by, shuffle the top card of the Tekeli-li deck into your deck without looking at it (for each card you cannot shuffle, take 1 horror).
[tablet]: –4. For each point you fail by, discard the top card of your deck. Draw each weakness discarded by this effect.
name: Ice and Death
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –X. X is half the shelter value of your location (rounded up).
[cultist]: –2. If you fail, shuffle the top card of the Tekeli-li deck into your deck without looking at it (if you cannot, take 1 horror).
[tablet]: –3. For each point you fail by, discard the top card of your deck. Draw each weakness discarded by this effect.

back_flavor:
“It was risky business sailing over the antarctic in a single aëroplane without any line of bases...”
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
name: Crash Site
text: [action]: Test [intellect] or [agility] (3) to scavenge from the wreckage. If you succeed, in the “Supplies Recovered” section of the Campaign Log, record Spare Parts. (Max one success per campaign.) Shelter 0.

back_flavor:
“There now stretched off to the east the low, white line of the great ice barrier...”
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
flavor: The sun never quite sets over the horizon past the icy shoreline, painting the sky a myriad tapestry of beautiful colors.
name: Frozen Shores
text: Frozen Shores gets +2 shroud if an encounter card is attached to it. Shelter 2.

back_flavor:
“...in order to recover the Archaean slate vein in which he had found the odd markings, he would have to make a long sledge trip from these foothills to the steep slopes of the gigantic mountains themselves.”
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
name: Treacherous Path
text: Forced – After you reveal 1 or more [frost] tokens during a skill test at Treacherous Path: Take 1 damage or horror for each [frost] token revealed. Shelter 1.

back_flavor:
“The ice-sheet was very thin, with dark ground here and there visible...”
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
name: Precarious Ice Sheet
text: [reaction] When you draw a [[Hazard]] treachery while at Precarious Ice Sheet, add 1 [frost] token to the chaos bag: Cancel that card’s effects and discard it. (Group limit once per round.) Shelter 2.

back_flavor:
“...on the lofty ice barrier in the background, myriads of grotesque penguins squawked and flapped their fins...”
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
back_text: As an additional cost for you to enter this location, investigators at your location must spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.
name: Broad Snowdrifts
text: [reaction] When you successfully investigate Broad Snowdrifts, add 1 [frost] token to the chaos bag: Discover 3 additional clues at Broad Snowdrifts. (Group limit once per game.) Shelter 4.

back_flavor:
“...in ten more miles we came to an unbroken waste virtually without signs of sentient artifice.”
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
back_text: As an additional cost for you to enter this location, investigators at your location must spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.
name: Icy Wastes
text: Treat the modifier of the first [frost] token revealed during each skill test at Icy Wastes as –3, instead of –1. Shelter 4.

back_flavor:
“...rising perpendicularly to a height of 200 feet like the rocky cliffs of Quebec, and marking the end of southward navigation.”
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
back_text: As an additional cost for you to enter this location, investigators at your location must spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.
name: Rocky Crags
text: Forced – When a treachery is attached to Rocky Crags: That treachery gains surge. (Max once per phase.) Shelter 3.

back_flavor:
“...it surely looked like madness to find six imperfect monstrosities carefully buried upright in nine-foot snow graves under five-pointed mounds...”
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
back_text: As an additional cost for you to enter this location, investigators at your location must spend 2 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.
name: Snow Graves
text: [reaction] After you discover the last clue from Snow Graves, shuffle the top 3 cards of the Tekeli-li deck into your deck without looking at them: In the “Supplies Recovered” section of the Campaign Log, record Green Soapstone. (Group limit once per campaign.) Shelter 5.

back_flavor:
“...we effected a difficult landing on Ross Island shortly after midnight on the morning of the 9th...”
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
back_text: As an additional cost for you to enter this location, investigators at your location must spend 2 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.
name: Icebreaker Landing
text: [action]: Parley. Test [intellect] (4) to search the trapped ship for supplies. If you succeed, either remove 1 [frost] token from the chaos bag or record Small Radio in the “Supplies Recovered” section of the Campaign Log. (Max one success per campaign.) Shelter 5.

back_flavor:
“Close flying shews many cave-mouths, some unusually regular in outline, square or semicircular. You must come and investigate.”
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
back_text: As an additional cost for you to enter this location, investigators at your location must spend 2 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.
name: Frigid Cave
text: [action] Add 1 [frost] token to the chaos bag: In the “Supplies Recovered” section of the Campaign Log, record Mineral Specimen. (Group limit once per campaign.) Shelter 6.

back_flavor:
“Our camp on the frozen shore below the volcano’s slope was only a provisional one; headquarters being kept aboard the Arkham.”
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
back_text: As an additional cost for you to enter this location, investigators at your location must spend 4 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.
name: Barrier Camp
text: [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] (4) to convince some of the other explorers here to give you something useful. If you succeed, in the “Supplies Recovered” section of the Campaign Log, record Dynamite. (Max one success per campaign.) Shelter 7.

back_flavor:
“It is only with vast hesitancy and repugnance that I let my mind go back to Lake’s camp and what we really found there...”
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
back_text: As an additional cost for you to enter this location, investigators at your location must spend 4 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.
name: Remnants of Lake’s Camp
text: [action]: Test [combat] (4) to dig through the snow in search of supplies. If you succeed, in the “Supplies Recovered” section of the Campaign Log, record Wooden Sledge. (Max one success per campaign.) Shelter 7.

back_flavor:
“Parts, especially upper parts, seem to be of lighter-coloured rock than any visible strata on slopes proper, hence an evidently crystalline origin.”
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
back_text: As an additional cost for you to enter this location, investigators at your location must spend 4 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.
name: Crystalline Cavern
text: [action]: Test [agility] (5) to climb up one of the crystalline walls in search of evidence. If you succeed, in the “Supplies Recovered” section of the Campaign Log, record Miasmic Crystal. (Max one success per campaign.) Shelter 9.

name: Skittering Nonsense
text:
Hunter.
<b>Forced,/b> – When you defeat Skittering Nonsense: Shuffle the top card of the Tekeli-li deck into your deck without looking at it (if you cannot, Skittering Nonsense attacks you).

name: Apeirophobia
text:
<b>Revelation</b. – Test [willpower] (X), where X is your location’s shelter value. If you fail, you must decide (choose one):
- Take 1 horror for each point you failed by.
- Place 2 of your clues on your location.
- Add 1 [frost] token to the chaos bag.

name: Apeirophobia
text: Revelation – Put Zero Visibility into play in your threat area. As an additional cost for you to leave a location with a treachery attached to it, you must spend 1 action. Forced – At the end of your turn: Test [agility] (2). If you succeed, discard Zero Visibility.

back_flavor:
“Hold on! Come see this!” one of the other team members shouts as you trudge ahead through the snow. You turn back and examine what they have found—a second set of tracks in the snow, but smaller, misshapen. Almost impossibly so.
“What in the hell could have made these tracks?” one of your party asks. You stand dumbfounded. Very little wildlife exists out here in the frozen wastes. And these tracks match nothing you’ve ever seen before. Nothing you can even imagine.
You don’t have to question what could make such tracks for long. A shape emerges from the erupting snow, twisted and deformed, like a splotch of ink spilled upon the canvas of reality. It makes
a strange, almost familiar cry that is eaten by the howling wind: “—li! —li!” Then, with terrifying speed, it rushes toward you.
back_text: Spawn a set-aside Skittering Nonsense at the lead investigator’s location. Shuffle the remainder of the set-aside Skittering Nonsense enemies and the set-aside Creatures in the Ice encounter set into the encounter deck.
flavor: This isn’t exactly how you imagined your first foray into the Antarctic wilds. The stinging cold and lashing, frozen winds will only get worse over time.
name: Cold Welcome
text: Forced - After a location is entered by an investigator for the first time: Put into play each set-aside location connected to that location. (Use the map in the Campaign Guide for reference.)

back_flavor:
These things, these manifestations, they’re not beasts or even alien creatures like those Dyer and Danforth encountered in their last expedition. You’re not even sure they are entities at all. They have no shape, consisting of an almost proto-plasmic substance that seeps back into the ice when harmed or whenever you escape their clutches. Given the persistence of these entities and the inclement, deadly conditions of Antarctica, you know you won’t survive the night without finding shelter.
Just as you are pondering what your next move should be, the ice beneath you rumbles with tremendous force, letting out a terrifying groan. “An earthquake?” one of your party asks over the raucous noise.
“No, that’s impossible,” another replies. You share a dreadful glance. Could it be one of those...things?
back_text: Spawn the set-aside Terror of the Stars enemy at the revealed location with the highest shelter value.
flavor: Something dwells beneath the ice. Something you’ve never seen or heard of before, not even in William Dyer’s horrifying report. Something...unreal.
name: Into the White
text: Forced - After a location is entered by an investigator for the first time: Put into play each set-aside location connected to that location. (Use the map in the Campaign Guide for reference.)

back_flavor: You can go on no longer. It’s not ideal, but you’ll have to make do with the shelter you’ve found. You only hope that it’s enough to keep your party from freezing... or worse.
back_text: Each investigator, including those who are eliminated, shuffles the top card of the Tekeli-li deck into their deck. Choose a location in play with no clues on it. Each undefeated investigator moves to that location and immediately resigns. The higher that location’s shelter value, the better. If the investigators cannot choose such a location, they must move to the Crash Site and immediately resign, even if they otherwise could not. (Then, resolve the [[Objective]] on act 1a.)
flavor: The sun hangs low in the sky, but never sets. Your party is exhausted from the long , arduous day. Though the sky is never plunged into the dark of night, you know it’s only a matter of time before you are forced to make camp.
name: Running Out of Time
text: Forced - After a location is entered by an investigator for the first time: Put into play each set-aside location connected to that location. (Use the map in the Campaign Guide for reference.)

back_flavor: Exhausted and terrified by your ordeal, you decide this is as good a place as any to make camp for the night. Perhaps tomorrow you can salvage some kind of academic value out of this hellish journey, but for now such things seem trivial. Survival is the only thing on your mind.
flavor: You’re going to have to find a way back to camp, and soon...or you’ll have to make due camping in the wilds.
name: Search for a Camp Site
text: [action] If each investigator is at the same location and that location has no clues on it: Resign. You set up camp. Each investigator resigns. Objective – Find somewhere safe to set up camp. If each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance. The higher the shelter value of the location they resigned at, the better.

name: Terror of the Stars
text:
Hunter. Massive.
Terror of the Stars gets +3 [per_investigator] health.
While Terror of the Stars is ready, investigators cannot resign at its location or discover clues at its location.

back_flavor: As you journey through the glacial wilds, you stumble across a set of tracks in the snow leading farther from camp. You pause and investigate further. Were these tracks made by one of your missing team members? Or by something more...monstrous?
back_text: Choose a facedown encounter card beneath a location. Look at the other side of that card (without resolving its text). Then return it facedown beneath that location.
flavor: Several of your party have mysteriously vanished in the night. Without a sign of any struggle, you can only assume they left of their own accord...but why?
name: A Harsh Wind Blows

back_flavor: As you journey through the glacial wilds, you stumble across a set of tracks in the snow leading farther from camp. You pause and investigate further. Were these tracks made by one of your missing team members? Or by something more...monstrous?
back_text: Choose a facedown encounter card beneath a location. Look at the other side of that card (without resolving its text). Then return it facedown beneath that location.
flavor: The low-hanging sun dimly illuminates the Antarctic night. Gray clouds cover the sky, threatening an icy storm.
name: The Chill of Night

back_flavor:
As the night ends, the storm arrives in its full ferocity. Raging, icy winds and dense snowfall make your task impossible. You’ll never find the remaining team members in these conditions, and even if you did...
A hard lump of guilt and despair forms in your throat. There’s no way they would survive in this storm, not without supplies or shelter. That you are forced to choose between your life and theirs is a burden you will surely carry with you for the rest of your life. And you’ll be lucky if that's more than a couple of days.
back_text: Each remaining investigator is defeated and suffers 1 mental trauma. (→R1)
flavor: The storm grows closer, and with it looming in the sky, that damnable sound returns. It haunts you with its presence, worming its way into your mind. Is it the cause of this folly? This madness?
name: Madness and Death

back_flavor: With night coming to a close, the storm approaches faster and faster. Soon, the weather will be too deadly for your search to continue. If anyone is still out there, you doubt they’ll survive—and neither will you if you remain unsheltered any longer. You return to your camp, your heart heavy with guilt and and your mind addled by that foul noise that festers within.
flavor: You set out to search for the missing team members, hoping to find them before daybreak...
name: The Lost Expedition
text: [fast] Investigators at your location spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Draw the encounter card beneath your location. [action] If you are at camp: Resign. You turn in for the night. Objective – Find as many missing expedition members as you can by adding them to the victory display, then head back to camp before daybreak. If each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance.

flavor: There is nothing here but ice and snow, and no sign of any missing team members. Frustrated, you turn back. You won't find anyone here.
name: Dead End
text:
Remove 1 [frost] token from the chaos bag.
Add this story card to the victory display.

flavor:
As you traverse the glacial wilds, something rumbles and churns beneath your feet. Is that where these depths of the ice?
A somber thought crosses your mind. If you are right, such entities could exert their vile influence no matter where you stand. Perhaps this has something to do with your missing companions after all, though there are no signs of them here.
name: Cracks in the Ice
text:
Search your deck for a copy of Tekeli-li and place it on the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck without resolving it. Shuffle your deck.
Add this story card to the victory display.

flavor: You come across evidence of one of your lost companions, abandoned and half-buried in snow—torn scraps from a heavy fur coat and a pair of goggles. Examining the goggles closely yields a terrifying discovery—a dark, sticky substance that you cannot, for the life of you, identify.
name: Somber Remains
text:
Search the top 9 cards of your deck for each copy of Tekeli-li and place each one you find on the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck without resolving it. Shuffle your deck.
Add this story card to the victory display.

flavor:
The tracks continue for some time before vanishing , bafflingly, into the snow. There’s no sign of any struggle, nor are there any other tracks that might indicate where they could have gone. Could the winds have covered the tracks? And if so, why were you able to follow the rest of the footprints so easily?
But when you turn back to examine the prints you first followed, they too are gone.
name: Disappearing Footprints
text:
Remove 1 [frost] token from the chaos bag.
Add this story card to the victory display.

flavor: You follow a set of tracks into a small cavern carved into a glacial wall, and your stomach lurches at the sight before you. One of your missing team members lies in a crumpled heap at the end of the hollow, his clothing torn open. A clean vertical incision has bisected his torso open from his sternum to his belly, and his entrails have been carefully removed. You struggle not to retch. Who could have possibly done such a thing?
name: Dissected Explorer
text:
Search your deck for a copy of Tekeli-li and place it on the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck without resolving it. Shuffle your deck.
Add this story card to the victory display.

flavor: You are fleeing from a creature made of kaleidoscopic ooze when you suddenly freeze in place, a web of cracks reaching out across the ice beneath your boots. Your breath catches in your throat. Another step could spell your doom or save your life. Behind you, the entity gains on you, reaching out with arms that are not quite solid or liquid. Feeling lucky, you decide to roll the dice, striking the ground behind you and fleeing to the side. Just as you hoped, the ice is thin enough to splinter open, and the creature tumbles down through the crack, into the icy depths. You breathe a sigh of relief, thankful you did not share a similar fate.
name: Evil Within
text:
Discard an [[Eidolon]] enemy that does not have the [[Elite]] trait from play.
Add this story card to the victory display.

flavor: You follow a set of footprints through the snow, hoping they will lead you to a sign, any sign, of your lost companions. Sadly, the evidence you discover is not the kind you were hoping to find. Where the prints end, you find an ice pick covered in freshly frozen blood. To your horror, a human eye lies nearby, staining the snow red. A shudder creeps up your spine. What on Earth could compel somebody to do such a thing?
name: Bloody Evidence
text:
Search the top 9 cards of your deck for each copy of Tekeli-li and place each one you find on the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck without resolving it. Shuffle your deck.
Add this story card to the victory display.

flavor: To your relief, you come across one of your missing team members—but they are not themself. Their eyes glazed over, their expression dazed and lost. A murky, slimy substance drips from their face and trickles onto the ice below. When you finally manage to get through to them, they wipe the strange, inky miasma from their face, staining their cheeks black. “What...was I doing?” they ask.
name: Madness Inside
text:
Choose a [[Possessed]] enemy in play that does not have the [[Elite]] trait. Take control of each doom on that enemy, flipping them to their clue sides. Discard the chosen enemy.
Add this story card to the victory display.

name: Professor William Dyer
text: [action] Choose and discard up to 2 cards from your hand: Parley. Place that many resources on Professor William Dyer (from the token bank). If there are 3 [per_investigator] resources on him, add him to the victory display. Forced – If Professor William Dyer is defeated: Cross his name off in the Campaign Log.

name: Danforth
text: [action]: Parley. You listen closely to Danforth’s rambling. Draw up to 2 cards from the top of the Tekeli-li deck. Then, place that many resources on Danforth (from the token pool). If there are 3 [per_investigator] resources on him, add him to the victory display. Forced – If Danforth is defeated: Cross his name off in the Campaign Log.

name: Eliyah Ashevak
text: [action]: Parley. Test [agility] (2) to sneak by Anyu and speak with Eliyah. For each point you succeed by, place 1 resource on him (from the token pool). If you fail, he attacks you. If there are 2 [per_investigator] resources on him, add him to the victory display. Forced – If Eliyah Ashevak is defeated: Cross his name off in the Campaign Log.

name: Dr. Mala Sinha
text: [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] (2) to attempt to calm Dr. Sinha down. For each point you succeed by, place 1 resource on her (from the token pool). If you fail, she attacks you. If there are 2 [per_investigator] resources on her, add her to the victory display. Forced – If Dr. Mala Sinha is defeated: Cross her name off in the Campaign Log.

name: Avery Claypool
text: [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (5) to get Claypool to stop babbling nonsense. If you succeed, place 1 resource on him (from the token pool)Forced – If Avery Claypool is defeated: Cross his name off in the Campaign Log.

name: James “Cookie” Fredericks
text: Retaliate. [action]: Parley. Test [combat] (2) to wrestle the gun away from Cookie. For each point you succeed by, place 1 resource on him (from the token pool). If you fail, he attacks you. If there are 2 [per_investigator] resources on him, add him to the victory display. Forced – If James “Cookie” Fredericks is defeated: Cross his name off in the Campaign Log.

name: Dr. Amy Kensler
text: [action]: Parley. Test [intellect] (2) to convince Dr. Kensler to tell you what she has seen. For each point you succeed by, place 1 resource on her (from the token pool). If you fail, she attacks you. If there are 2 [per_investigator] resources on her, add her to the victory display. Forced – If Dr. Amy Kensler is defeated: Cross her name off in the Campaign Log.

name: Roald Ellsworth
text: [action]: Parley. Test [combat] or [agility] (5) to get Ellsworth to let go of the strange rock he is clutching. If you succeed, place 1 resource on him (from the token pool). If you fail, he attacks you. If there are 1 [per_investigator] resources on him, add him to the victory display. Forced – If Roald Ellsworth is defeated: Cross his name off in the Campaign Log.

name: Takada Hiroko
text: [action] Spend up to 3 resources: Parley. Place each of these resources on Takada Hiroko. If there are 5 [per_investigator] resources on her, add her to the victory display. Forced – If Takada Hiroko is defeated: Cross her name off in the Campaign Log.

back_flavor: This place is not what it seems. You feel as though you have trespassed somewhere ancient and terrible, and now its wrath is erupting all around you.
back_text:
The lead investigator must decide (choose one):
- Add 1 [frost] token to the chaos bag.
- In player order, each investigator shuffles the top 2 cards of the Tekeli-li deck into their deck (each investigator who cannot takes 1 damage and 1 horror instead).
flavor: Something stirs beneath the ice. Through the cracks, a vile ichor bubbles forth, its odor pungent and rancid.
name: Manifestations of Evil
text: Forced – When this agenda would advance, if there is at least 1 facedown card beneath a Seeping Nightmare: Instead of advancing this agenda, remove 2 doom from play and find the Seeping Nightmare with the most facedown cards beneath it. Choose one of the cards beneath it at random and spawn it at its location.

back_flavor:
Your only warning is a thin web of cracks that tears through the ice before your feet, and then a sudden explosion of mist and ink-like miasma erupts around you. The force slams you to the ground. You crawl desperately along the freezing-cold ice as the miasma reaches for you. An incomprehensible sound, like the rushing of a furious whirlwind, fills your ears. Then a thunderous crack, and you are falling—no, sliding—down along the ice toward the freezing cold waters below.
It is a wonder you are even still conscious. You summon all of your strength and cling to the ice shelf just before you plummet below. You finally haul yourself back over the edge, casting a panicked glance at the horizon, but there is no sign of any miasma or mist. The crack in the ice shelf extends for hundreds of feet in front of you, separating you from your pursuers. Somehow, you’ve unwittingly escaped...although you won’t be forgetting that near-death experience anytime soon.
back_text: Each remaining investigator is defeated and suffers 1 physical trauma.
flavor: The violent quakes have risen to a crescendo. Any second now, you feel as though the entire ice shelf could collapse, spilling you into the frigid ocean—or worse, if your theory about the underground source of these creatures is correct.
name: Icy Depths

back_text:
If there are no [[Eidolon]] enemies in play:
The last of the nightmarish creatures falls, its miasmatic body at once dissolving into inky, prismatic liquid and dissipating into wisps of gray mist filled with screaming shapes. Then, silence.
(→R1)
If the investigators advanced by resigning:
You follow a makeshift path through a jagged split in the ice shelf, making your way deeper into the mainland, toward the mountains. You don’t know if these creatures can follow human tracks—or indeed if they need tracks at all in order to pursue you—but you take the time to cover them, regardless. Hopefully, with this shortcut you’ve found, you’ll be safe...
(→R1)
flavor: Your camp has been discovered, and now the monsters prowling about the ice and snow are converging on your position. You have only two ways out of this nightmare: you must fight, or you must flee.
name: Under Attack!
text: Each [[Eidolon]] enemy gains Victory 0. The camp gains: “[action] Investigators at your location spend 4 clues, as a group: Resign.” Objective – If there are no [[Eidolon]] enemies in play, advance. Objective – If each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance.

name: Seeping Nightmare
text: While an [[Eidolon]] enemy at Seeping Nightmare’s location is moving, its location is considered connected to the camp. While there are no facedown cards beneath Seeping Nightmare, it gains hunter. Forced – When Seeping Nightmare is defeated: Remove each facedown card beneath it from the game.

name: Phantasmagoria
text: <b>Revelation</b. – If there are no Seeping Nightmares in play, Phantasmagoria gains surge. Otherwise, find the Seeping Nightmare nearest to an investigator. If there are 1 or more cards beneath it, choose one of them at random and spawn it at its location. If there are no cards beneath it, it moves and attacks as if it were the enemy phase (without exhausting).

flavor: "We should never have come back."
name: Professor William Dyer
text:
Partner. Uses (3 secrets).
[fast] Spend 1 secret and exhaust Professor William Dyer: Heal 2 horror from an investigator or another [[Ally]] asset at your location.

flavor: "...the windowless place... wings... eyes in the darkness..."
name: Danforth
text:
Partner. Uses (5 secrets).
[reaction] After an investigator at your location resolves a Tekeli-li weakness, exhaust Danforth and spend 1 secret: That investigator draws 3 cards. Discard each Tekeli-li weakness drawn by this effect without resolving its effects.

flavor: "I know, Anyu. This place is all wrong."
name: Eliyah Ashevak
text: Partner. Uses (3 secrets). [fast] During your turn, spend 1 secret and exhaust Eliyah Ashevak: Evade. Attempt to evade with a base [agility] skill of 6. If you succeed, you may move to a connecting location.

flavor: "I'll see what I can do, but some of these wounds are beyond the understanding of modern medicine..."
name: Dr. Mala Sinha
text:
Partner. Uses (3 supplies).
[fast] Spend 1 supply and exhaust Dr. Mala Sinha: Heal 2 damage from an investigator or another [[Ally]] asset at your location.

flavor: "These are not stormclouds. These are something else entirely."
name: Avery Claypool
text:
Partner. Uses (3 supplies).
[reaction] When an investigator at your location reveals a [frost] token during a skill test, exhaust Avery Claypool: Cancel that token. Then, you must either reveal a new chaos token, or spend 1 supply.

flavor: "Next thing that moves is gettin' a lead hole through its teeth."
name: James "Cookie" Fredericks
text: Partner. Uses (3 ammo). [fast] during your turn, spend 1 ammo and exhaust James "Cookie" Fredericks: Fight. Fight with a base [combat] skill of 6. If you succceed and the attacked enemy is non-[[Elite]], it cannot attack for the remainder of the round.

flavor: "The beings that built this place... did they create this, too?"
name: Dr. Amy Kensler
text: Partner. Uses (3 secrets). [fast] During your turn, spend 1 secret and exhaust Dr. Amy Kensler: Investigate. Investigate with a base [intellect] skill of 6. If you succceed, look at the top card of any investigator's deck or the encounter deck. You may discard that card.

flavor: "I thought I knew this place. I really did."
name: Roald Ellsworth
text:
Partner. Uses (3 supplies).
[fast] During an investigator's turn, exhaust Roald Ellsworth or spend 1 supply: Choose a non-weakness in play. Treat that treachery's text box as if it were blank until the end of this turn.

flavor: "No wonder nobody has flown over these parts."
name: Takada Hiroko
text:
Partner. Uses (9 resources).
[action] Exhaust Takada Hiroko: Gain 1 resource. Move up to 3 resources from Takada Hiroko to your resource pool.

back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –X. X is 2 plus the level of your location.
[cultist]: –1. Move to the location directly below you.
[tablet]: –4. If you fail, lose control of an [[Expedition]] asset and place it at your location.
[elder_thing]: –5. If you fail, the nearest [[Elder Thing]] enemy moves once toward you. If it is engaged with you, it attacks.
name: Ice and Death
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –X. X is the level of your location.
[cultist]: –1. If you fail, move to the location directly below you.
[tablet]: –3. If you fail, lose control of an [[Expedition]] asset and place it at your location.
[elder_thing]: –4. If you fail, the nearest [[Elder Thing]] enemy moves once toward you. If it is engaged with you, it attacks.

back_flavor: The mountainside splits and erupts with snow. A storm of jagged ice shards bursts forth from the womb of the mountain. Behind it, the beast emerges: a whirlwind of mist; haunting , alien shapes; hideous effluvia. It sets its terrible gaze on your party and reaches for you with a tendril of miasma.
back_text: Put the set-aside Terror of the Stars enemy into play at the highest level location with one or more investigators. Each investigator at that location loses control of all [[Expedition]] assets and places them at their location. Read Scenario Interlude: Tragedy Strikes in the Campaign Guide.
flavor: You arrive at the foothills of the menacing mountain. The strange caves and odd formations at the mountain’s summit beg to be explored.
name: Forbidden Peaks
text: Forced - After you move to a location: Return all of your clues to the token pool.

back_flavor: The snowfall is so thick now that you can no longer see your destination, nor can you hear your companions’ shouts over the howling wind. Every step takes the breath out of you. The air is so thin up here, it is a wonder you even have any breath to spare. You glance up at the blanket of white cast in an endless net overhead. Perhaps you were never close to the summit—just another trick of the eye, like everything else in this godforsaken place.
back_text: If one or more investigators have resigned, proceed to (→R1). Otherwise, proceed to (→R2).
flavor: The once-flurrying snow has become a tempest of wind and heavy snowfall. If you don’t make it across the peaks soon, you’ll be forced to take shelter...or spend the rest of eternity as a frozen corpse along the mountainside.
name: Terror Descends
text: Forced - After you move to a location: Return all of your clues to the token pool.

back_flavor: After a long and arduous journey up the mountainside, you’ve reached the forbidden peaks. You hope the pain and horror you’ve suffered along the way is behind you, but you fear that it will persist...and become relentless.
flavor: Carrying as much expedition gear as you can, you must climb the imposing mountainside to unlock the secrets that lie on the other side.
name: Ascend the Mountain
text: [action]: Take control of an [[Expedition]] asset at your location. Objective – Get to the top of the mountain. If each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance.

back_flavor:
“The touch of evil mystery in these barrier mountains, and in the beckoning sea of opalescent sky glimpsed betwixt their summits, was a highly subtle and attenuated matter...”
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
back_text: You cannot enter this location unless all of the clues on the location directly below it have been discovered.
name: Deep Drifts
text: Forced – After you move to Deep Drifts from a location below it: Discard the top 3 cards of your deck. Draw each weakness discarded this way.

back_flavor:
“The touch of evil mystery in these barrier mountains, and in the beckoning sea of opalescent sky glimpsed betwixt their summits, was a highly subtle and attenuated matter...”
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
back_text: You cannot enter this location unless all of the clues on the location directly below it have been discovered.
name: White Bluff
text: Forced – After you move to White Bluff from a location below it: Test [agility] (X). X is 1 plus this location’s level. If you fail, lose control of an [[Expedition]] asset and place it at White Bluff.

back_flavor:
“The touch of evil mystery in these barrier mountains, and in the beckoning sea of opalescent sky glimpsed betwixt their summits, was a highly subtle and attenuated matter...”
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
back_text: You cannot enter this location unless all of the clues on the location directly below it have been discovered.
flavor:
“The last stage of our descent to the town was unusually steep and abrupt....”
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
name: Steep Incline
text: Forced – After you move to Steep Incline from a location below it: Take 1 damage.

back_flavor:
“The touch of evil mystery in these barrier mountains, and in the beckoning sea of opalescent sky glimpsed betwixt their summits, was a highly subtle and attenuated matter...”
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
back_text: You cannot enter this location unless all of the clues on the location directly below it have been discovered.
flavor:
“...before noon we all felt a thrill of excitement at beholding a vast, lofty, and snow-clad mountain chain which opened out and covered the whole vista ahead.”
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
name: Narrow Ridge
text: Forced – After you move to Narrow Ridge from a location below it: Take 1 horror.

back_flavor:
“The touch of evil mystery in these barrier mountains, and in the beckoning sea of opalescent sky glimpsed betwixt their summits, was a highly subtle and attenuated matter...”
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
back_text: You cannot enter this location unless all of the clues on the location directly below it have been discovered.
flavor:
“They had crossed the icy peaks on whose templed slopes they had once worshipped and roamed among the tree-ferns.”
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
name: Rocky Ledge
text: Forced – After you move to Rocky Ledge from a location below it: Shuffle the top card of the Tekeli-li deck into your deck without looking at it.

back_flavor:
“The touch of evil mystery in these barrier mountains, and in the beckoning sea of opalescent sky glimpsed betwixt their summits, was a highly subtle and attenuated matter...”
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
back_text: You cannot enter this location unless all of the clues on the location directly below it have been discovered.
flavor:
“The distribution of cryptical cave-mouths on the black snow- denuded summits seemed roughly even....”
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
name: Snow-Covered Crag
text: Forced – After you move to Snow-Covered Crag from a location below it: Exhaust each asset you control.

back_flavor:
“The touch of evil mystery in these barrier mountains, and in the beckoning sea of opalescent sky glimpsed betwixt their summits, was a highly subtle and attenuated matter...”
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
back_text: You cannot enter this location unless all of the clues on the location directly below it have been discovered.
name: Windswept Path
text: Forced – After Windswept Path is revealed: If it is at level 0, place 1 [per_investigator] clues on it (from the token pool). Forced – After you move to Windswept Path from a location below it: Place 1 clue on it (from the token pool).

back_flavor:
“As we drew near the forbidding peaks, dark and sinister above the line of crevasse-riven snow and interstitial glaciers, we noticed more and more the curiously regular formations...”
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
back_text: You cannot enter this location unless all of the clues on the location directly below it have been discovered.
name: The Summit
text: Clues on The Summit can only be discovered by investigating. Forced – When The Summit is revealed: Add 1 [frost] token to the chaos bag. [action]: Resign.,/b> Add each [[Expedition]] asset you control to the victory display. Return all of your clues to the token pool.

name: Terror of the Stars
text: Hunter. Massive. Terror of the Stars gets +3 [per_investigator] health. X is the level of your location (to a minimum of 1). Forced – At the end of the round: Move all investigators at Terror of the Stars’s location to the location directly below it.

name: Constricting Elder Thing
text:
Hunter.
X is the level of your location (to a minimum of 1).
While Constricting Elder Thing is engaged with you, you cannot move to locations above your location.

flavor:
“...the still lower horizon-grazing southern sun of midnight poured its hazy reddish rays over the white snow, bluish ice and water lanes, and black bits of exposed granite slope.”
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
name: Snowfall
text: Revelation(from the token pool).

name: Avalanche
text: Revelation – If the level of your location is 1–4, move to the location directly below you. Then test [willpower] (X). X is the level of your location. If you fail, repeat this process. If you did not move by this effect, Avalanche gains surge.

name: Hanging on the Edge
text: Revelation – Test [agility] (3). If you fail, take 2 damage, lose control of each [[Expedition]] asset you control (placing it at your location), and move to the location directly below you.

name: Hypothermia
text: Revelation – Test [willpower] (3). If the level of your location is 4 or 5, reveal 1 additional chaos token for this skill test. If you fail, either add 1 [frost] token to the chaos bag, or take 1 horror for each point you failed by.

name: Green Soapstone
text:
Uses (4 charges).
[reaction] When you perform a successful attack, spend 1 charge and exhaust Green Soapstone: Deal +1 damage for that attack.

name: Wooden Sledge
text:
[action] Exhaust Wooden Sledge: An investigator at this location searches the top 6 cards of their deck for up to 3 non-weakness [[Item]] or [[Supply]] cards and attaches them facedown to Wooden Sledge. Shuffle their deck.
While Wooden Sledge is under an investigator's control, facedown cards attached to it may be played as if they were in the hand of any investigator at its location.

name: Dynamite
text:
Uses (2 supplies).
[action] Spend 1 supply and exhaust Dynamite: Choose either your location or a connecting location. Deal 3 damage to each enemy and investigator at the chosen location.

name: Miasmic Crystal
text:
Uses (3 charges).
[reaction] When an investigator at your location draws a Tekeli-li weakness, spend 1 charge: That investigator cancels the effects of that weakness, places it on the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck, and draws 1 card.

name: Mineral Specimen
text: Uses (3 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge: Investigate. Investigate with a base [intellect] skill of 5. Cancel each [frost] token revealed during this test. If you succeed, discover 1 additional clue at your location.

name: Small Radio
text: Uses (3 supplies). You may trigger abilities on assets from the Expedition Team encounter set that are not in play, but whose names are not crossed off in the Campaign Log. Instead of paying that ability's non-[action] costs, exhaust Small Radio and spend 1 supply.

name: Spare Parts
text:
Uses (3 supplies).
[fast] Spend 1 supply and exhaust Spare Parts: Add 1 supply to another asset at your location, or choose an investigator at your location to gain 1 resource.

name: Frostbitten
text: Revelation - Put Frostbitten into play in your threat area. Frostbitten can be healed as if it were a single point of damage on you (if it is healed, discard it). Forced - When you reveal a [frost] token during a skill test: You must either take 1 damage or you automatically fail this test. (Limit once per test.)

name: Possessed
text: Revelation - Put Possessed into play in your threat area. Possessed can be healed as if it were a single point of horror on you (if it is healed, discard it). Forced - When you reveal a [frost] token during a skill test: You must either take 1 horror or you automatically fail this test. (Limit once per test.)

flavor: "Doubt of the real facts, as I must reveal them, is inevitable." - H.P. Lovecraft, At the Mountains of Madness
name: Professor William Dyer
text:
Partner. Uses (3 secrets).
[action] Spend 1 secret and exhaust Professor William Dyer: Heal 2 horror from an investigator or another [[Ally]] asset at your location.

flavor: "Danforth was a great reader of bizarre material..." - H.P. Lovecraft, At the Mountains of Madness
name: Danforth
text:
Partner. Uses (5 secrets).
[reaction] After an investigator at your location resolves a Tekeli-li weakness, exhaust Danforth and spend 1 secret: That investigator draws 2 cards.

flavor: "Anyu's got the scent. Haven't you, girl?"
name: Eliyah Ashevak
text: Partner. Uses (3 secrets). [action] Spend 1 secret and exhaust Eliyah Ashevak: Evade. Attempt to evade with a base [agility] skill of 5. If you succeed, you may move to a connecting location.

flavor: "Want to survive the trip? Good. Then don't get on my bad side."
name: Dr. Mala Sinha
text:
Partner. Uses (3 supplies).
[action] Spend 1 supply and exhaust Dr. Mala Sinha: Heal 2 damage from an investigator or another [[Ally]] asset at your location.

flavor: "Weather is turning foul again. I would tell you to turn back, but I gather you would refuse - right?"
name: Avery Claypool
text:
Partner. Uses (5 supplies).
[reaction] When an investigator at your location reveals a [frost] token during a skill test, exhaust Avery Claypool and spend 1 supply: Cancel that token and reveal a new one.

flavor: "No I ain't leavin' my damn gun back at camp!"
name: James "Cookie" Fredericks
text: Partner. Uses (3 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo and exhaust James "Cookie" Fredericks: Fight. Fight with a base [combat] skill of 5. If you succceed and the attacked enemy is non-[[Elite]], it cannot attack for the remainder of the round.

flavor: "All of this is so fascinating! Do you not agree?"
name: Dr. Amy Kensler
text: Partner. Uses (3 secrets). [action] Spend 1 secret and exhaust Dr. Amy Kensler: Investigate. Investigate with a base [intellect] skill of 5. If you succceed, look at the top card of any investigator's deck or the encounter deck. You may discard that card.

flavor: "I have been all over the world. Please, just trust me."
name: Roald Ellsworth
text:
Partner. Uses (5 supplies).
[fast] During an investigator's turn, exhaust Roald Ellsworth and spend 1 supply: Choose a treachery attached to any location. Treat that treachery's text box as if it were blank until the end of this turn.

flavor: "Nobody knows these machines better than I do."
name: Takada Hiroko
text:
Partner. Uses (9 resources).
[action] Exhaust Takada Hiroko: Move up to 3 resources from Takada Hiroko to your resource pool.

flavor:
"Still came that eldritch, mocking cry - 'Tekeli-li! Tekeli-li!'"
 - H.P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness.</u>
name: Tekeli-li
text: Revelation - Take 1 horror. Place Tekeli-li on the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck.

flavor:
"Still came that eldritch, mocking cry - 'Tekeli-li! Tekeli-li!'"
 - H.P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness.</u>
name: Tekeli-li
text: Revelation - Take 1 damage. Place Tekeli-li on the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck.

flavor:
"Still came that eldritch, mocking cry - 'Tekeli-li! Tekeli-li!'"
 - H.P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness.</u>
name: Tekeli-li
text: Revelation - Discard 1 card at random from your hand. Place Tekeli-li on the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck.

flavor:
"Still came that eldritch, mocking cry - 'Tekeli-li! Tekeli-li!'"
 - H.P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness.</u>
name: Tekeli-li
text: Revelation - Lose 2 resources. Place Tekeli-li on the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck.

flavor:
"Still came that eldritch, mocking cry - 'Tekeli-li! Tekeli-li!'"
 - H.P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness.</u>
name: Tekeli-li
text: Revelation - If it is your turn, lose 1 action. Otherwise, lose 1 action during your next turn. Place Tekeli-li on the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck.

flavor:
"Still came that eldritch, mocking cry - 'Tekeli-li! Tekeli-li!'"
 - H.P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness.</u>
name: Tekeli-li
text: Revelation - Place 1 of your clues on your location. Place Tekeli-li on the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck.

flavor:
"Still came that eldritch, mocking cry - 'Tekeli-li! Tekeli-li!'"
 - H.P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness.</u>
name: Tekeli-li
text: Revelation - Discard an asset you control. Place Tekeli-li on the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck.

name: Claypool's Furs
text:
Fast.
[reaction] When you reveal a [frost] token during a skill test you are performing, deal 1 damage to Claypool's Furs: Cancel that chaos token and return it to the bag. Reveal a new chaos token.

name: Collected Works of Poe
text:
Uses (3 charges).
[action] Spend 1 charge: Choose an investigator at your location to search the top 6 cards of their deck for each copy of Tekeli-li and place each of them on the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck. Shuffle that investigator's deck. That investigator draws 1 card.

name: Cookie's Custom .32
text: Fast. Uses (2 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. Either fight with a base [combat] skill of 5, or get +2 [combat] for this attack. This attack deals +1 damage.

flavor: Professor Dyer kept many sketches depicting the creatures he encountered.
name: Dyer's Sketches
text:
Fast. Play during any [fast] window.
Draw 3 cards.

name: Ellsworth's Boots
text:
Limit 1 [[Footwear]] per investigator.
[reaction] After the last clue is discovered from your location, exhaust Ellsworth's Boots: Move to a connecting location, or discard Ellsworth's Boots to move to any revealed location.

name: Kensler's Log
text: Fast. Uses (2 secrets). [action] Spend 1 secret: Investigate. Either investigate with a base [intellect] skill of 5, or get +2 [intellect] for this investigation. If you succeed, you discover 1 additional clue at your location.

name: Sinha's Medical Kit
text:
Uses (3 supplies).
[fast] Exhaust Sinha's Medical Kit and spend 1 supply: Heal 1 damage or 1 horror from an investigator or [[Ally]] asset at your location.

flavor: Takada left these spare supplies behind. Maybe you can make use of them.
name: Takada's Cache
text:
Fast. Play during any [fast] window.
Gain 3 resources and draw 1 card. Remove Takada's Cache from the game.

name: Anyu
text: [fast] Exhaust Anyu: Choose one, or discard Anyu to choose up to three, in any order - - Move to a connecting location. - You get +2 skill value for your next skill test this round. - Evade. Attempt to evade with a base [agility] skill of 4.
